steps.title: Get the materials.
steps.content: Get the materials. Thread a long, thin sewing needle with thread matching the material you are going to sew.

steps.title: Secure the thread end.
steps.content: Secure the thread end. Knot one end of the thread.

steps.title: Prepare the fabric.
steps.content: Prepare the fabric. Iron the material fold to crease it if necessary. For example: with hems, or edges of applique.

steps.title: Prepare the fabric.
steps.content: Prepare the fabric. Position the fabrics and pin them in place.

steps.title: Begin sewing.
steps.content: Begin sewing. Slide the needle into the material from the back side to attach the thread to the material. The thread knot will hold in the material after the needle has been pulled through.

steps.title: Make even stitches.
steps.content: Make even stitches. Start by making long stitches in one piece of fabric and tiny stitches in the other. Carefully position the needle points of exit or entry into the fabric to make the hemming thread appear invisible. See sketch.

steps.title: Inspect the stitches.
steps.content: Inspect the stitches. By working even stitches, they will be hidden in the fabric fold.

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished. Congratulations on your new sewing skill!
